titleStmt.title: At Mr. Barnes' booth between the Crown-Tavern and the Hospital-Gate, in the Rounds over-against the Cross Daggers in West-Smith-Field where you will see the English flag hang out on the top of the booth, during the time of Bartholomew-Fair, is to be seen the famous rope-dancers in Europe, being four companies joyn'd in one, viz. the English, High-German, French and Morocco.
titleStmt.author: Barnes, Mr.

titleStmt.title: At Mr. Barnes' booth between the Crown-Tavern and the Hospital-Gate, in the Rounds over-against the Cross Daggers in West-Smith-Field where you will see the English flag hang out on the top of the booth, during the time of Bartholomew-Fair, is to be seen the famous rope-dancers in Europe, being four companies joyn'd in one, viz. the English, High-German, French and Morocco.
titleStmt.author: Barnes, Mr.

notesStmt.note: Title taken from first six lines of text.
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
